sentences.en: A woman in Niger , where many infants are already malnourished, can expect to have eight children.
sentences.cn: 在已有众多营养不良婴儿的尼日尔, 妇女期望拥有八个孩子.

sentences.en: And, noting that many mothers are also malnourished, he said the humanitarian cost is enormous.
sentences.cn: 他提到, 很多母亲也有营养不良问题, 这方面的人道援助耗资巨大.
很可能他也会营养不足.

sentences.en: If untreated, diarrhea is frequently fatal in already malnourished children.
sentences.cn: 若不治疗, 痢疾对已患有营养不良的儿童往往是致命的.

sentences.en: Malnourished children are more likely to succumb to infections.
sentences.cn: 营养不良的儿童更有可能死于感染.

sentences.en: Malnourished children have smaller brains, fewer neurons and synapses, shorter dendrites and less myelin.
sentences.cn: 营养不良的儿童有规模较小的脑, 少的神经元和突触的, 短的树突少髓鞘.

sentences.en: Patients with analbuminemia are not malnourished andwith simple malnutrition are rarely hypoalbuminemic.
sentences.cn: 低白蛋白血症患者并不缺乏营养,并且单纯的营养缺乏很少导致低白蛋白血症.

sentences.en: Researchers warn that malnourished people may be a breeding ground for more dangerous infectious diseases.
sentences.cn: 研究人员警告说,营养不良者可能产生更危险的传染病.

sentences.en: The factory workers were found to be abused and malnourished.
sentences.cn: 工厂工人被发现遭受虐待,身体营养不良.

sentences.en: Therefore , every effort must be made to promote lactation , even among sick and malnourished mothers.
sentences.cn: 因此, 即使对于虚弱、营养不良的母亲,也应大力鼓励母乳喂养.

words.tran_cn: 营养不良的；营养失调的

trans.tran_cn: 营养失调的，营养不良的
trans.tran_en: someone who is malnourished is ill or weak because they have not had enough good food to eat
